alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freezing Fog Advisory issued January 18 at 1:59AM PST until January 18 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FREEZING FOG ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Icy roads and visibility less than one mile in freezing fog. * WHERE...Valley locations in Plumas, Sierra, Lassen, and northern Washoe Counites. This includes Susanville, Doyle, Honey Lake and Highway 395 north of Hallelujah Junction. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility and potential for ice on roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Fog may not completely clear out today with continued travel difficulties along US-395 from Doyle to Susanville, and along portions of Hwy-70 from Hallelujah Junction to Portola.
info.instruction: A light coating of ice and low visibility may lead to treacherous driving conditions. Slow down and avoid braking and making sudden turns. Be careful walking outside as slipping and falling greatly increases the risk of injuries.
